intro: Mahernia heterophylla, commonly known as the variable leaf mahernia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to Australia, specifically found in the southern regions of Western Australia. The plant is characterized by its variable leaf morphology, with leaves that can be either simple or lobed depending on the environment. It produces small, white or pink flowers arranged in clusters, which attract various pollinators. Mahernia heterophylla typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to dry, sunny conditions.
